questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a best practice when writing a Dockerfile for a Node.js application?
questions.code_example:
# Dockerfile example
FROM node:14

WORKDIR /app

COPY package*.json ./

RUN npm install

COPY . .

EXPOSE 3000

USER root

CMD ["npm", "start"]

options.A: Using a specific Node.js version instead of 'latest'
options.B: Running the application as root user
options.C: Copying package.json before other files to leverage Docker caching
options.D: Explicitly exposing the port the application will use
